author: jgm
content: A quick update on the state of the chain and proportion of correct head votes.  This has seen a marked improvement in the last few weeks, most likely due to the roll-out of updated clients with improvements to block creation and propagation time.  Hard to tell what the final impact of the changes are, as there are no doubt some clients that have yet to be updated, but it's way better than it was, even in the face of on-going additional validators.

author: jgm
content: Big shout out to the client teams who have carried out these optimizations, they have a real impact on the network.

author: dkdkdkdkdkdk
content:
1. is there value in discouraging running multiple validators on the same device?
2. if so, would it make sense to increase the penalty when multiple validators stop attesting in the same epoch?

author: trent_vanepps
content: This actually exists, though not per device. Penalties are higher when more stake goes offline

author: yorickdowne
content: I know slashing penalties are higher when more get slashed together, and there is an inactivity penalty once finality is lost ... but harsher offline penalties depending on how many are offline, that’s the first I hear of it. Assuming it’s still comfortably less than 1/3rd offline.

author: yorickdowne
content: <@!132497957135187968> I don’t see the value. Economy of scale is a thing even for small stakers. For a single stake, hosting costs are borderline unreasonable compared to alternatives such as “mutual fund”; it’s when someone runs multiple validators that the “fee” for running gets reasonable compared to the reward
